org.ingatan.component.image
Class LibraryResourceBrowser

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  org.ingatan.component.image.LibraryResourceBrowser
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class LibraryResourceBrowser
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Displays all image files contained by the selected library.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

thumbnailPane

protected ThumbnailPane thumbnailPane
Displays all images contained within the currently selected library.

scrollThumbnailPane

protected javax.swing.JScrollPane scrollThumbnailPane
Scroller for the thumbnail pane.

comboLibraryList

protected javax.swing.JComboBox comboLibraryList
Drop down list of all libraries, as obtained from the IOManager.

currentLib

protected Library currentLib
The currently selected library (a library should only exist as a Library object if it must be read or written to - the name of a library can simply be taken from the IOManager).

Constructor Detail

LibraryResourceBrowser

public LibraryResourceBrowser(java.lang.String libraryID)
Creates a new LibraryResourceBrowser, displaying libraryID as the default library (as well as all images within that library).

Parameters:
libraryID - the library that is opened first.
Method Detail

loadThumbnailPane

protected void loadThumbnailPane()
                          throws java.io.IOException
Loads thumbnails from the current library. This is done by loading each image within the library, creating a 64x64 copy, and then flushing the original. This saves on memory.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is any problem loading the image files.

changeLibrary

protected void changeLibrary(java.lang.String libraryID)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Changes the current library to libraryID. Loads and displays the resources located within that library.

Parameters:
libraryID - the library to display.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem accessing the library.

getSelectedImageID

public java.lang.String getSelectedImageID()
Gets the currently selected image ID. This is the ID, unique within at least the library, that acts as a reference to that image resource.

Returns:
the currently selected image's ID.

getSelectedLibraryID

public java.lang.String getSelectedLibraryID()
Gets the ID of the currently selected library. The ID is the unique identifier for the currently selected library.

Returns:
the ID of the currently selected library.
